intro: Amsinckia calycina, commonly known as the California fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Amsinckia calycina is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
